sen.j: 阿紀神社（あきじんじゃ）は奈良県宇陀市に鎮座する神社。
sen.e: Aki-jinjya is the Shinto Shrine located in Uda City, Nara Prefecture.
Aki-jinjya is the Shinto Shrine located in Uda City, Nara Prefecture.
Aki-jinja is the Shinto Shrine located in Uda City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 旧社格は県社、延喜式内社。
sen.e: This shrine was classified as prefectural shrine in the old shrine ranking system Engishiki (Engishikinaisha).
This shrine was classified as prefectural shrine in the old shrine ranking system (Engishiki).
This shrine was classified as prefectural shrine in the old shrine ranking system (Engishiki).

sen.j: 旧称は阿貴宮および神戸大神宮、通称は神戸明神。
sen.e: the former names were Akinomiya or Kobe daijingu, and its commom name is Kobe-myojin.
It was formerly known as Akinomiya or Kobe daijingu, and its commom name is Kobe-myojin.
It was formerly known as Akinomiya or Kobe daijingu, and its commom name is Kobe-myojin.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 神代に神楽岡に創建され、崇神天皇の勅によって神戸大神宮の号を賜わる。
sen.e: This shrine was first built in Kaguraoka in the age of gods, and given the name of Kobe Daijingu at the imperial order by Emperor Suijin.
This shrine was first built in Kaguraoka in the age of gods, and given the name of Kobe Daijingu at the imperial order by Emperor Suijin.
This shrine was first built in Kaguraoka in the age of gods, and given the name of Kobe Daijingu at the imperial order by Emperor Suijin.

sen.j: 安土桃山時代（天正年間）に本郷川西岸の現在地に遷座されたときに、現在の社名へと改められた。
sen.e: During Azuchi-Momoyama period (Tensho era), when this shrine was relocated to the west bank of Hongo-gawa River, the present location, the name of the shrine was changed into the present one.
During the Azuchi-Momoyama period (Tensho era), when this shrine was relocated to its current location on the west bank of Hongo-gawa River, the name of the shrine was changed into the present one.
During the Azuchi-Momoyama period (Tensho era), when this shrine was relocated to its current location on the west bank of Hongo-gawa River, the name of the shrine was changed into the present one.

sen.j: 江戸時代前期に能舞台が建設され、能が上演されるようになる。
sen.e: In early years of the Edo period, a Noh stage was constructed in the precincts of the shrine, and Noh plays began to be performed.
In early years of the Edo period, a Noh stage was constructed in the precincts of the shrine, and Noh plays began to be performed.
In early years of the Edo period, a Noh stage was constructed in the precincts of the shrine, and Noh plays began to be performed.

sen.j: 明治35年に郷社から昇格して県社に列格した。
sen.e: In 1902, this shrine promoted from Gosha (a village shrine) to Kensha (a prefectural shrine)
In 1902, this shrine was promoted from Gosha (a village shrine) to Kensha (a prefectural shrine)
In 1902, this shrine was promoted from Gosha (a village shrine) to Kensha (a prefectural shrine).
sen.cmt: 文末にピリオドを付けました。

sen.j: 祭神 - 天照皇大神、秋田比売神、邇邇杵命、八意思兼神

sen.j: 合祀祭神 - 天水分神、菅原道真、金山彦神、金山姫神

sen.j: 近鉄大阪線 榛原駅 から奈良交通バス「大宇陀」行きで20分、終点下車、徒歩15分
sen.e: From Kintetsu Haibara Station (Osaka line), get on a Nara Kotsu bus bounding for 'Ouda' and get off at the final bus stop, then walk about 15 minutes.
